security_audit.summary: This skill is a markdown-based guidance document with no executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution. It only contains workflow instructions for AI behavior. No security concerns detected.

content.user_title: Apply proven workflows to every task
content.value_statement: Tasks often repeat solved problems because AI agents skip established workflows. This skill ensures you always check for relevant skills before starting, follow mandatory workflows like brainstorming before coding, and track all checklist items with TodoWrite.
actual_capabilities: Checks for relevant skills before any task
Creates TodoWrite todos for all checklist items
limitations: Does not create or modify other skills
Does not execute code or scripts
Does not access external files or APIs

use_cases.title: Learn proven workflows
use_cases.description: New users learn established patterns for task execution from the start

use_cases.title: Maintain consistency
use_cases.description: Experienced developers maintain disciplined workflows across all projects

use_cases.title: Enforce standards
use_cases.description: Team leads ensure all tasks follow documented best practices

prompt_templates.title: Basic skill check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if a relevant skill exists for this task. If one exists, announce and use it.

prompt_templates.title: With checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the [Skill Name] skill. Create a TodoWrite todo for each checklist item.

prompt_templates.title: Brainstorming first
prompt_templates.prompt: Before writing code, brainstorm the approach. Use the brainstorming skill if available.

prompt_templates.title: Verification step
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify the work is complete. Use the verification-before-completion skill if available.

output_examples.input: Add a new feature to the application
output: Announcing skill usage: 'I'm using the using-superpowers skill to ensure I follow the proper workflow.'
Checking for relevant skills: Found 'test-driven-development' skill which is applicable.
Creating TodoWrite todos for each checklist item.
Following TDD workflow: Write test first, then implement code.

best_practices: Always announce which skill you are using before starting work.
Create a separate TodoWrite todo for each checklist item - never batch or skip.
Read the current version of skills - memory of previous versions may be outdated.
anti_patterns: Working through a checklist mentally without creating TodoWrite todos.
Skipping a skill because 'the task seems simple' or 'I remember how to do this.'
Treating specific instructions as permission to skip established workflows.

faq.question: Does this skill work with all Claude tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for workflow enforcement.

faq.question: What if no relevant skill exists?
faq.answer: Proceed with standard practices but consider documenting the approach as a new skill.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with other skills?
faq.answer: This skill helps you discover and use other skills. Chain it at the start of any task.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only reads documentation. It does not access files, execute code, or send data.

faq.question: Why must I announce skill usage?
faq.answer: Announcing skill usage confirms you read it and helps users understand your process.

faq.question: How is this different from other productivity skills?
faq.answer: This skill is meta - it helps you find and use all other skills consistently.
